actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Judiciary.

official_title: A joint resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States to abolish the electoral college and to provide for the popular election of the President and Vice President.

summary.text: Constitutional Amendment - Provides that the President and Vice President shall be elected by popular vote at such time, place, and manner as the Congress by law shall provide. States that the election of the President and the Vice President shall be determined by a majority of the votes cast, or in the event no person receives a majority, by plurality of the votes cast.

titles.title: A joint resolution proposing an amendment to the Constitution of the United States to abolish the electoral college and to provide for the popular election of the President and Vice President.
